DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : EF5 may detect presence oxygen tumor cell help plan effective cancer treatment . PURPOSE : Phase I trial study effectiveness EF5 detect presence oxygen tumor cell patient undergo surgery biopsy breast , prostate , cervical cancer high grade soft tissue sarcoma .
DOC.brief_title: EF5 Prior Surgery Biopsy Patients With Breast , Prostate , Cervical Cancer High Grade Soft Tissue Sarcoma
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : I . Determine optimal dose etanidazole derivative EF5 safely tolerate provide optimal bind resected tumor specimen tumor biopsy patient breast , head neck , prostate , cervical carcinoma high grade soft tissue sarcoma . II . Define toxic effect EF5 patient population . OUTLINE : This dose-escalation study . Patients receive etanidazole derivative EF5 IV 1-2 hour . Approximately 24-48 hour EF5 treatment , patient undergo surgical resection biopsy tumor . Cohorts 6 patient receive escalate dos EF5 maximum tolerate dose ( MTD ) optimal dose determine . The MTD define dose precede 2 6 patient experience dose-limiting toxicity . The optimal dose define dose level precede MTD result optimal tumor-to-normal-tissue binding . Patients follow 28 day . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 18-36 patient accrue study within 12-18 month .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : Histologically proven breast , head neck , prostate , cervical carcinoma high grade ( define grade 2 3 ) soft tissue sarcoma Sarcoma tumor must confine truncal extremity location Must clinical condition physiologic status demonstrate appropriate standard initial therapy tumor surgical biopsy resection Tumors great 15 cm diameter Hormone receptor status : Not specify PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age : 18 Menopausal status : Not specify Performance status : ECOG 0 1 Life expectancy : Not specify Hematopoietic : Absolute neutrophil count great 2,000/mm3 Platelet count great 100,000/mm3 Hepatic : Bilirubin le 2.0 mg/dL Renal : Creatinine le 2.0 mg/dL OR Creatinine clearance great 50 mL/min Cardiovascular : No significant cardiac disease would preclude safe use general anesthesia Pulmonary : No significant pulmonary disease would preclude safe use general anesthesia Other : Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test Fertile patient must use effective contraception 1 month study No grade 3 4 peripheral neuropathy PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy : Not specify Chemotherapy : Not specify Endocrine therapy : Not specify Radiotherapy : Not specify Surgery : See Disease Characteristics
